content: Hemanta K. Maji Hemanta K. Maji (Last updated: 07 December, 2023) I am interested in Cryptography and Algorithms; with special emphasis on Secure Computation and Information-theoretic Cryptography. I am looking for motivated students who are interested in Cryptography. The NSF CISE Research Initiation Initiative (CRII) Award, NSF SMALL Awards CNS--1618822, CNS--2055605, and CCF--2327981 (along with multiple REUs) the IARPA HECTOR project, MITRE Innovation Program Academic Cybersecurity Research Awards (2019--2020, 2020--2021), a Purdue Research Foundation (PRF) Award, a Ross--Lynn Research Scholar Grant (2022), and The Center for Science of Information, an NSF Science and Technology Center, Cooperative Agreement CCF--0939370 support his research. Associate Professor, Purdue, 2023-present Assistant Professor, Purdue, 2015-2023 Center Fellow, CEF, UCLA, 2013-2015 CI-Fellow, 2011-2013 Ph.D., UIUC, 2011 (thesis) B.Tech., IIT-Kanpur, 2004 CV: [pdf] Office: LWSN 1177 Phone: (765) 494-6184 Email: hmaji@purdue.edu Research Teaching Students Scientific Service Useful Resources And Now for Something Completely Different...
